answers.answer: i am a vlounteer and the mom of a type one diabetic.  i have listed  below the warning signs andd symptoms of diabetes. if your child has any otf these symptoms i wouod contact your doctor immediately to have him checked out.Knowing the warning signs for type 1 diabetes (juvenile diabetes) could save a child's life.Warning signs of type 1 diabetes (these may occur suddenly):Extreme thirstFrequent urinationSudden vision changesSugar in urineFruity, sweet, or wine-like odor on breathIncreased appetiteSudden weight lossDrowsiness, lethargyHeavy, labored breathingStupor, unconsciousnessIf your child exhibits one or more of these symptoms, call a doctor immediatelyi hope this helps.

question: im new here just wanted some info on children with diabetes im waiting for my sons blood results to come back from docs. he started off drinking large amounts of fluids urinating alot then began to wet the bed which he has never done before now he eats excessive amounts of food huge bowl of cereal two rounds of toast then has toast at ten ocloack at school then dinner at twelve and comes out of school starving demanding his food and crys for it so has a sandwich before tea then his tea then still complains he is still hungry and has another bowl off cereal or anything can get his hands on even plain bread but has not been gaining weight may be losing it he has terrible mood swings and crys a lot for the simplist of things and getting worse he wet himself at school which is a first. some times he has lack of energy other times he seems overly energetic he sleepe well but has huge dark rings around his eyes and pale began to cry with stomach pains nothing has changed at home or school to make him behave this way he looks generaly ill he is seven years old im at witts end waitingany info would be appreciated zoe
title: mood swings and extreme hunger
